text: Feature request - Ability to specify what edit buttons are available for use. These options write inline styles which break branding guidelines. So I either have to wipe out inline styles with javascript or use !Important in parent stylesheet.

Hey Jacob, a few messages up <@UA7JFQSQ0> mentions this: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CFPRTEGTX/p1589383128161900> Would you be able to post in that thread you thoughts regarding the question?

I think providing a list to show would be nice. That way if something new is added it can be vetted before released in the wild. Would these settings be for each instance or is it a global setting?

Personally I would just have a need for a global setting.

Thank you for considering this update because currently it is causing a lot of confusion and page edits to correct.

I think providing a list to show would be nice. That way if something new is added it can be vetted before released in the wild.

Would these settings be for each instance or is it a global setting?Personally I would just have a need for a global setting.

Thank you for considering this update because currently it is causing a lot of confusion and page edits to correct.

We’re starting by having it just set at the module instance since that’s more at the MVP level for us, but we’re considering how we can make it more global. The only problem with a global setting is that each toolbar is a little different and might have different controls, so we just need to make sure we handle that the right way.
is anyone seeing an issue with extra spacing in design manager when using bool checkboxes in custom modules?
this happens on safari and chrome as of today... has not been doing this in the past and there has been no changes to the module source
